alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 31 at 4:12PM AKST until February 03 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TUESDAY TO NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 70 below expected. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Along the Yukon River near Eagle. * WHEN...3 AM Tuesday to noon Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds are expected to develop early Tuesday morning causing very cold wind chills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
